edu.wpi.grip.core.operations.networktables

Annotation Type NTValue


  • @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface NTValue
    Annotation for accessors of values that should be published to NetworkTables.

    Using annotations to define these methods instead of having the class implement a method in an interface allows an object (such as ContoursReport to have arbitrarily many publishable values. More values (like x, y, width, height, etc...) can be added simply by adding more accessors with this annotation.

    One potential way of having multiple values without using annotations might be to make the interface method return a list, but this would prevent us from knowing how many values there are and what their names are without having an instance of the object being published.

    The weight of each accessor must be specified. This determines order of the inputs to NTPublishOperation. It's important to specify weights if there are multiple keys because otherwise, different JVMs will return them in different orders, leading to projects that are interpreted differently on different machines.

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      int weight 

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.String key 

    • Element Detail

      • weight

        public abstract int weight

      • key

        public abstract java.lang.String key
        Default:
        ""
